intro: Ranunculus flabellatus, commonly known as the fanleaf buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features delicate, palmately lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers with five to nine petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It is characterized by its short, stout stems and is part of the Ranunculaceae family. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often found in native plant gardens and conservation areas.
